alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Hamilton; Marion; Rhea; Sequatchie (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 22 at 7:38PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Rhea, Sequatchie, Bledsoe, northeastern Marion and northeastern Hamilton Counties through 930 PM EST/830 PM CST/... At 838 PM EST/738 PM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Gruetli-Laager, or 9 miles west of Dunlap, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Dunlap, Pikeville, Soddy-Daisy, Whitwell, Graysville, Cartwright, Flat Top Mountain, North Chickamauga Creek Gorge and Griffith Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
